oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic Centre Wales Technical Note 3: Biology and Management of Soil pests
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Anon,
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Education, extension and communication
Production systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The majority of crops grown in the UK are host to single or multiple insect pests that feed on the growing plant at some stage of their life cycle. Insect pest is not strictly correct terminology because the pests come from a wide range of families or groups, from Coleoptera (beetles), Diptera (true flies), Lepidoptera (butterflies and moths), Molluscs (slugs and snails) and Nematodes. This technical sheet lists major and minor pests, provides a simple key for identifying soil pests, lists requirements for effective cultural control of pests and lists sources of further information.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Anon, (2005) Organic Centre Wales Technical Note 3: Biology and Management of Soil pests. Organic Centre Wales.
